title: Enums [1]
description:
An enum is basically a name to integer conversion you can use in if statments. you define an enum with  
enum name = {
    name = 1,//you can use any number
    name = 2,
    ...
};, then check if somthing is equal to a value via just writing if varofenumtype == enumvalue. you should make enum values allcaps.

CBit OS needs a enum to define all our status codes!. make the status enum, with the bindings OK = 0, ERROR = 1, and TIMEOUT = 2.
expectedOutput:
PASS: maxOf(3, 7) == 7
PASS: maxOf(2.5f, 1.5f) == 2.5
PASS: maxOf(4.0, 4.5) == 4.5
